story.title: Philip Morris, Altria End Merger Talks
story.summary: PYDXUZT0G1KX(Bloomberg) -- Tobacco giants Philip Morris International Inc. and Altria Group Inc. have ended their merger discussions.“After much deliberation, the companies have agreed to focus on launching IQOS in the U.S. as part of their mutual interest to achieve a smoke-free future,” Philip Morris Chief Executive Officer André Calantzopoulos said Wednesday in a statement, referring to his company’s heat-not-burn device.Separately, Altria Chief Strategy and Growth Officer K.C....

xmlText.p: (Bloomberg) -- Tobacco giants Philip Morris International Inc. and Altria Group Inc. have ended their merger discussions.

“After much deliberation, the companies have agreed to focus on launching IQOS in the U.S. as part of their mutual interest to achieve a smoke-free future,” Philip Morris Chief Executive Officer André Calantzopoulos said Wednesday in a statement, referring to his company’s heat-not-burn device.
Separately, Altria Chief Strategy and Growth Officer K.C. Crosthwaite stepped down from the company to become CEO of Juul Labs Inc., replacing Kevin Burns, who is leaving.
Shares of Philip Morris jumped more than 5% in early trading, while Altria rose about 1%.
To contact the reporter on this story: Lisa Wolfson in Boston at lwolfson@bloomberg.net
To contact the editors responsible for this story: Anne Riley Moffat at ariley17@bloomberg.net, Eric Pfanner
For more articles like this, please visit us at bloomberg.com
